page.title: 08A TYPICAL EIGHT YEAR OLD
page.content: I come to school at 8.45 and (after hanging up my coat in our cloakroom) I go into my classroom and start work. At 8.55 the teacher takes the register and we all go to the hall where the headteacher speaks to us. From 9.30 to 10.40 I work by myself at whatever of my work needs to be finished. We then have ten minutes playtime when I usually play football with my friends. When I return to the classroom sometimes we have P.E. or I sit on the carpet with my teacher and a group of other children for a lesson on English or Mathematics. We have our lunch at school and at 1.25 the afternoon session starts. We read quietly for a quarter of an hour and then our work varies every day until just before home time when our teacher reads to us.
